title: For Sale:  ****SOLD  Browning A5 Sweet 16 ga., mfg 1954, 28" plain bbl  SOLD****
postcontent:
This is a beautiful project gun for someone who wants to have an historic project for their collection.  This is a Browning A5 Sweet 16 ga., mfg 1954, 28" plain bbl with all the beautiful damascus like patina and it has a reasonably good stock.  When finished this would make a beautiful addition to any shooter's collection.  Item G-36391-1.

The Browning Automatic 5, most often Auto-5 or simply A-5, is a recoil-operated semi-automatic shotgun designed by John Browning. It was the first successful semi-automatic shotgun design, and remained in production until 1998. The name of the shotgun designates that it is an autoloader with a capacity of five rounds, four in the magazine and one in the chamber.  

The Browning Auto-5 was the first mass-produced semi-automatic shotgun. Designed by John Browning in 1898 and patented in 1900,[2] it was produced continually for almost 100 years by several makers with production ending in 1998. It features a distinctive high rear end, earning it the nickname "Humpback". The top of the action goes straight back on a level with the barrel before cutting down sharply towards the buttstock. This distinctive feature makes it easy to identify A-5s from a distance. A-5s were produced in a variety of gauges, with 12 and 20 predominating; 16 gauge (not produced between 1976 and 1987) models were also available. The gun saw military service worldwide between World War I and the Vietnam War.

We have additional higher resolution pictures of this item available upon request.

title: For Sale:  .32 ACP +P Ammo - 75 gr. Hardcast F.N. (1150fps/ M.E. 220 ft. lbs.) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
https://www.extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=132


The 32 ACP auto inhabits a valuable and useful place in our society as a defensive cartridge, mostly because of the easily concealable, tiny pistols chambered for it. HOWEVER, because of the very limited size of the cartridge, it is plagued with limited power and therefore most of the existing ammo in 32 ACP suffers from not being reliable as a man-stopper. We've studied and examined nearly all available 32 ammo and find it wanting as a reliable means of self defense, especially against a large, drugged up/pain free, determined attacker.

Here's the problem. The current 32 ACP frangible ammo delivers a large amount of surface trauma, but lacks sufficient penetration. For example, if you shot me or another sane man in the face, with modern, frangible 32 ACP ammo, it would blow off a big portion of my cheek. I would undoubtedly fall to the ground in shock and pain, but I would be very much alive and functional if I could get past the pain, as that frangible bullet would have stopped somewhere in my face, never making it to my brain. However, if you shot a drugged up maniac in the face with that same frangible bullet and blew half his cheek off, he would keep right on coming because he is insane and is not thinking like you or I. Plus, he is likely pain free and fear free and won't know that part of his cheek is missing and if he did know, he would not care. So, whatever 32 ACP ammo you shoot him in the face with, had better go through his face and blow his brain stem out the back of his head, because only a CNS (central nervous system) hit with a 32 ACP is going to stop him. Likewise, a torso hit to the sternum needs to penetrate deep enough to blow all the way through his spine in order to shut him down instantly. If you fail to shut him down instantly, you and your loved ones are going to have to find a way to survive while you wait for him to bleed out and pass out. The best chance of survival for you and your loved ones, is to shut down the attacker instantly. So, we've designed this 32 ACP+P load to keep you and yours alive under the worst of scenarios.

This 32 ACP+P ammo will better all American made 32 ACP+P ammo by 110 fps to 150 fps with a heavier bullet than any other American made 32 ACP ammo.

Item 30A/20 is a 75gr. HARD cast bullet with a flat nose. It is traveling over 1,000 fps out of my 3.4 inch Beretta Mod. 70. We've used a flash suppressed powder so that you won't be blinded by your own gunfire in the dark. This is significant as well over 90% of all civilian shootings in America occur in low light when the criminal element is out and about. Also, this flat nosed, nonexpanding, hard cast, bullet will penetrate deeply and will do much more damage than the typical round nosed FMJ bullet. Round nosed bullets tend to slip and slide through living tissue, doing little damage as opposed to a flat nosed bullet. The flat nose not only wounds much more than a round nosed bullet, but it actually keeps the penetration straight and thus deeper. Notice the below velocities from my personal 32 ACP pistols. These are real world guns and thus the speeds are realistic and not the exaggerated speeds you'll see produced from laboratory test barrels. What you see with Buffalo Bore Ammo advertising, is truly what you get in the "real world" where it matters. You can expect 20+ inches of straight line penetration in flesh and bone with this load. If you are worried about over-penetration with this load, DON'T! You chose to carry a tiny under-powered 32 ACP pistol and the trade off is that now you are going to have to stay alive using this pistol and over-penetration will be the least of your worries if you end up needing this gun to save yourself or your family.

A. Berretta Mod. 70, 3 inch bbl.- 1001 fps

B. Kel Tek, 2.5 inch bbl - 910 fps

C. Seecamp, 2 inch bbl. - 856 fps

The above bullet speeds are 110 fps to 150 fps faster than the Winchester 71 gr. FMJ ammo on the American market. Not only is our bullet heavier than any other American made 32 ACP ammo, but it is moving about 15% to 20% faster - with that heavier bullet!
Feeding and function was flawless in the three test pistols listed above.

title: For Sale/Trade:  45* Angle BUIS dioptic iron sights
location: NE Tacoma, Federal Way, Seattle, Washington
postcontent:
These sights are brand new. No wear at all. They are super sturdy for the price. Full adjustments for windage and yardage. Very snug fit.

Machined from lightweight, extremely durable 7075 aluminum, Mil-Spec hard anodized 
Same height above bore as standard-issue M4 / M16A4 sights 
1/2 MOA elevation and windage adjustments 
Ambidextrous sights easily and securely mount to Picatinny rails using a flathead screwdriver 
Low-profile sights extend only .2" above top rail, don't interfere with primary optics or military IR illuminator /laser sight 

For AR-15 / M16 type rifles, optical sights provide superior performance at longer ranges, but iron sights can be more effective for close-range engagements. 
However, attaching an optical sight either prevents the use of iron sights or results in a setup that produces a front sight "shadow" on the optical image, and/or results in problematic transitions from optical to backup iron sights. 
Not anymore. Rapid Transition Sights (RTS) provide shooters with the quickest possible transition between longer- and closer-range target acquisition, greatly increasing their efficiency and effectiveness in battle and competition. 
These sights mount directly to a weapon's Picatinny rail, offset from center by approximately 45°. 

This unique offset position makes transitioning from optical to iron sights simply a matter of quickly canting the weapon with your wrists and locking on to the target. 
There's no removing a hand from the weapon or making a manual adjustment, and no cluttered field of vision or iron sights blocking the optical sight. 
Just smooth, quick transitions that could mean the difference between winning or losing a competition, or more importantly - a gunfight. 
Weight: Rear sight - 3 ounces (85g) / Front sight - 1.5 ounces (44g)

title: For Sale:  FN 7.62x39 Portugese, Brass, 320 Rd Battle Packs
postcontent:
This is perhaps the best 7.62x39 ammo ever imported into the US.  Made by FN in Portugal.  It's almost never seen for sale in the US.  Headstamp says "FNM 91-1  7.62x39".  This is brass, Berdan-primed, non-corrosive.

Each battle pack contains 320 rounds.  I have 5 battle packs.  4 are sealed/unopened, 1 has been opened.  Price is per battle pack.

This is the cleanest shooting x39 ammo I've ever fired.  I used it in a Mini-30 that didn't care for the cheap steel-cased stuff.  This ammo was 100% reliable in the gun.  I've traded the gun and no longer need this ammo.

10% discount if you buy it all.

title: For Sale:  Browning BDM 9mm Factory 10 Shot Magazine Blue Steel New Take-out BRO942011L Browning Double Mode discontinued pistols ca. 2003 production
postcontent:
Our # XMBRO942011L

NO MAGAZINE SALES into NEW YORK CITY This listing is for One Magazine; Buyers, however, may take any number we have available at the same per-mag price and with no additional shipping charges. Photo shows brand new factory magazines for the Browning Double Mode 9mm Pistol, the BDM. The pistol was similar to the venerable Hi-Power, but the magazines did not interchange. These magazines are what we call take-outs; that is, they were taken out of new pistol boxes when a certain onerous Federal Law sunset in 2004. Manufacturer was Mec-Gar as principal supplier to Browning Arms. These are factory Browning magazines. Construction is all steel body and springs with a slick bright blue finish. Cartridge follower and floorplate or tail piece are polymer. Each magazine holds 10 rounds of 9mm ammunition: 9mm Parabellum, 9x19, 9mm Luger, call it what you will, THE 9mm. Marking, as the photos show, is Browning BDM / 9mm Luger / 10 Rd Cpcty / Made in USA. This magazine is for the full size BDM pistol. It will not fit a Hi-Power, or an FNP, or the cigarette lighter cavity of a 1953 Nash Metropolitan Convertible. We have plenty of similar construction 10 Shot Hi-Power Magazines at very attractive prices anyway, less than $20 apiece. Replacement pricing for these BDM magazines is upwards of $60.00 apiece, and they aren’t always easy to come by. We're offering the magazines in the photos or their identical mates, however, for only $ 29.00 apiece. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission from the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into any of the six boroughs or 176 some odd zip codes, per NYC Code 10-131.10

Grips, Magazines, Slings, Holsters, Scopes, Mounts, Parts & Most any small light items, entire accessory orders only $10.00 total shipping no matter how many a person buys. $10.00 for an entire order, Not $10.00 per item or anything of the sort. $20 Flat Fee on magazine orders to Alaska, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico, and gun parts to PR civilians must ship to an FFL. Magazines and any small light non-gun items ride free with ammo orders. We accept checks with no more than 7 days hold. GA Pay, MC, Visa, Discover phone- or fax-in 7 3 1 9 8 9 4 7 2 3 orders, USPS Money Order items shipped ASAP please put your full information, venue number, and what the item is on any messages. Internet phone hours 8:00 – 5:00 CST Mon – Fri. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340. We buy, sell, and trade. Always have, since 1952.

postcontent:
Looking to sell my P226 which has been set up for accurate shooting in a competition setting, but would also make a sweet daily carry.  Has TG-H3 fiber optic front sight and Sig #9 rear night sight.  The best part about this gun is the short reset trigger.  Absolutely no take-up after reset like the P226 is know to have in the standard trigger.

Will also come with 2 factory Sig 15 round mag, one Mec-Gar 18 round mag ($37 each), and three Mec-Gar 20 round mags ($45 each).

Sig Factory Upgrades:
1)  Action Enhancement Package - $180
Polished all trigger surfaces which lightens the trigger as well as removes the "gritty" feel.  Also lowers the DA trigger pull to around 7-8lbs and the SA trigger pull to 3.5lbs.

2)  Short Reset trigger package - $100
Reduces trigger reset by about 60%, reduced follow up shot times.

3)  Installed night sights - $120
Sights SIGLITE Night Sights, TRUGLO Tritium Fiber Optic front sight

4)  Feed ramp polish - $30
Improved and more reliable feeding

So basically $430 worth of upgrades on an already outstanding firearm.  All this new would total around $1450 not including tax.  Asking $975, will come with original case as well.

The Stainless Target II 9mm blends the features and performance expected from Kimber in a stainless steel pistol with increased resistance to the elements. Essentially a stainless steel version of the Custom II with adjustable sights, it has a match grade barrel, chamber, trigger and barrel bushing, along with a frame and slide carefully machined from solid steel. title: For Sale/Trade:  Remington 700 Classic in .243 Winchester $450
postcontent:
Free-floated 22" barrel, walnut stock that showes some handling marks, but is otherwise in great shape.  Factory sporter-weight barrel is free-floated. Blued steel.  No open sights.  Hinged floorplate magazine.

Year of manufacture is 1985, well before the recent recall on the "X-mark Pro" trigger.  Speaking of the trigger, this one is absolutely beautiful!  Crisp, with very little (if any) overtravel.  The trigger and the smoothness of the action won me over when I was considering whether or not to buy it.  I bought this rifle up to use the action for building up a precision .260 or 7mm-08, but I've since realized that I just don't have the finances for it.

If you're interested, email me and I'll send pics.  Otherwise I'll take some pictures and get them posted up here soon.

Buyer must present valid WAC card or concealed carry permit and driver's license, and sign a bill of sale.

(Scope and rings not included.)

title: For Sale:  AR-15 Stripped Upper Receivers and Complete M16 BCGs
postcontent:
We just received our latest batch of AR-15 upper receivers and M16 bolt carrier groups.
Upper receivers are 7075 Alum. forgings, machined to Mil Spec drawings and include the M4 machined feed ramps. Receivers are hard-coat anodized T marked and ready for forward asst. and dust cover installation. We're currently waiting on charging handles to come out of the shop which is why we are not able to provide them at this time but we do have a large quantity of complete ready to fire bolt carrier groups in-house.
The M-16/FA bolt carrier is machined from 8620, chrome lined and coated. The carrier also features a hardened gas key that is staked to military specifications. The bolts themselves are constructed from 9310, shot peened, and individually MP inspected, NOT BATCH INSPECTED.  
Stripped upper receivers are $68.00 + tx for Ohio residents only and shipping.
Complete bolt carrier groups are $95.00 + tx for Ohio residents only and shipping.
We're also currently running a special on receiver coatings. If the purchaser would like they can have their receiver(s) coated with KG Industries, Flat OD Green or Magpul FDE colors for an additional $20 per receiver.
Coated receivers add an additional two or three days to the shipping of the product.
Two receivers or one receiver and one bolt carrier group will ship for $6.25 anywhere within the lower 48.
We accept Visa, Mastercard, Discover, and American Express over the phone, those wanting to pay by check or money order should expect an additional 10-15 business days before item ships, all others ship same or following day of the order. Hours 9am-8pm EST Mon-Sun, Ph. REDACTED

title: For Sale:  FMK 9C1 G2 - 9mm pistol New In Box
postcontent:
Now, with a Fast Action trigger mechanism for the shooting enthusiast who prefers a quick short trigger pull with a drop free magazine, or the extra safe action inspired by a Double Action Only configuration with a mag-out safety, FMK Firearms has you covered either way.  This unique feature allows the shooter to choose which action they prefer without having to purchase another pistol.  The Fast Action Trigger comes standard for most States except CA and MA which come with the Double Action Only trigger.  Since the triggers are interchangeable the shooter can always purchase one of our trigger conversion kits and enjoy the features of both trigger systems.

Anther unique feature is the grip that has a rubberized backstrap. This backstrap not only effectively reduces felt recoil, it hugs and grips the palm of the shooting hand to provide a comfortable, positive grip. The result is a grip that seems to mold to the shooter’s hand, instead of having to mold your hand to fit the grip.

The 9C1 G2 is ergonomically built to comfortably fit both large and small hands.  The barrel is engineered to sit low for superior point and shoot accuracy and reduced muzzle flip, and the 9C1 G2 has virtually no external protrusions, making it ideal for concealed carry; and of course, it’s Proudly American.

Highlights for all models:

Compact Ergonomic Lightweight Design
Interchangeable Fast Action or Double Action Only Trigger
California, Massachusetts, Maryland and New York Approved
Snag Free Design Ideal for Concealed Carry
Picatinny Accessory Rail
Shock Absorbing Backstrap
Chamber Loaded Indicator
100% USA Made

title: For Sale:  Springfield XD-M 9mm 5.25" Competition Model
postcontent:
I'm selling my Springfield XD-M 9mm 5.25" Competition Model. I bought the gun a couple years ago with the intention of shooting USPSA matches with it, but I have never had the time so it's just sat in the closet. I would guess that it has less than 800 rounds through it, and it was completely stripped down and cleaned every time. 

I had a Powder River Precision match-grade trigger installed by a professional gunsmith, as well as grip panels for better control. The trigger breaks at about 3lbs, has absolutely no overtravel and a very short reset. It would be perfect for shooting competitively or just shooting for fun. 

As you can see in the pictures, I have all the original accessories with the exception of the holster, but I have an aftermarket holster that I will include with the gun. 

The retail price for this pistol is over $700, but I'm selling it for $600 OBO. I will also consider trades for a Ruger Gunsite Scout, a Remington 700 or Savage Model 10.

title: For Sale:  Still NEW AR 15 Fixed Stock & Scope by Docs Custom Sale         Gunsmith built & priced below assembly-line models
postcontent:
This is my M4 Carbine Model with Trijicon™-like scoped special. The upper begins with a 16’ Cryo-Treated Barrel with 1:7 twist and Basket Flash Suppressor (note cool grenade launcher attachment indents on the barrel). This M4-profile Gas Block is covered with Free-Float Carbine-length hand guards, and supported by an A-Frame Front Sight. The barrel assembly is attached to a Billet machined 7075-T6 aircraft aluminum alloy lower complemented by a single-stage ALG™ Nickel/Boron/Teflon™ Combat trigger (really trick!) with cool Magpul curved trigger guard, super-hard full-auto Bolt Carrier Group, Tactical Charging Handle, with ERGO™ oversized soft pistol grip, Magpul MOE non-adjustable light-weight Tactical Butt Stock with neat storage compartment, and 30-round magazine. The whole thing is topped with my favorite reasonably-priced optic, the Bushnell Illuminated 1x/2x Red/Green Dot MP Scope. Ok it’s not a Trijicon (and you are not spending thousands), but it sure looks really awesome, has elevation and windage adjustments, intensity dial, and even a 3-dot iron sight in case your battery goes dead!. This setup is what I carry most often and I really enjoy all types of shooting with it. It does everything well, is lightweight, sturdy, and performs as well for short or longer ranges. It is a great gun for all-around use.
I am sure you will love this AR

No trades please and feel free to contact me if you have any questions or/and if interested.

title: For Sale/Trade:  S&W 4" Model 19 $550
postcontent:
S&W Model 19-4 Blued 4" bbl. .357/.38  

I bought this used two years ago and sent it to the S&W mothership in Springfield Mass. for a little refurbishing and a full re-bluing, plus I've outfitted it with Boone Trading Company "Bonded Ivory" grips... So it looks really nice now... Nearly as-new. The original wood grips are also included. I've run less than 100 rounds (.38's) through
it since the re-bluing. (Holster not included. S&W factory re-bluing invoice is included.) 

Back in the 60's, 70's, 80's... Model 19's were very popular for law-enforcement carry and are legendary for their balance and easy point-shooting. This one was produced sometime around 1980. I'm letting it go because I find myself shooting my 6" more so this one doesn't see much action... and, I can use some funds. Cash deal for $550 is highly preferred but I will respond to reasonable firearm trade offers.    

Face-to-face transaction in Central NC only.

title: For Sale:  1916 Swedish Mauser, Bolt Action 6.5x55mm.
postcontent: 1896/M38 Swedish Mauser.  6.5x55mm.  CARL GUSTAFS STADS GEVARS FAKTORI, 1916.  HK 3728xx.  All matching.  24" Threaded BBL with flash suppressor.  Walnut stock.  Bore Disc 6.51 #1.  BBL CAI ST ALB VT M38 6.5x55 Sweden.  The Swedish Mauser Stock Disk markings on this rifle are:  Section 1 is marked "1" indicating a 6.51mm bore.  When the barrel erosion reached 6.55mm, it was decommissioned and replaced.  This would be considered near excellent bore at the time the disk was marked.  Section 2 "Condition of Bore" is marked "1" to indicate Minimal darkening in areas.  When the bore reached an evaluation of 4, it was replaced and is therefore not listed on the disk.  These markings indicate a very good to excellent bore in my opinion.  The markings are at http://candrsenal.com/tip-how-to-read-Swedish-mauser-stock-disks/.  Includes one box of cartridges (20 each 6.5x55).  Cash only.
